preqs: One of BCH2011, BCH2022, MOL2011, MOL2022, MCB2011, MCB2022; or BMS2021 or BMS2042

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BCH2011, BCH2022, CEL2012, MCB2011, MCB2022, MOL2011, MOL2022} OR  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BMS2021, BMS2042})
(Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BCH2011, BCH2022, CEL2012, MOL2011, MOL2022} OR  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BMS2021, BMS2042})

unitName: Cell signal transduction: Role in cancer and human disease
description: This unit provides an advanced understanding of the molecular aspects of cell proliferation, cell signalling, differentiation and cell death as they relate to cell biology and medicine, in particular cancer. Themes include basic mechanisms of cell signalling involving cell receptors, gene expression, hormones and endocrine networks, and intracellular signalling cascade. These concepts are applied to cell growth, differentiation and cell death and how the involvement of the immune system is regulated in diseases, including auto-immune diseases, cancer (and its treatment) and the destruction of T-cells after human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection.
